intro: Scottia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved scottia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in regions with mild, Mediterranean climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
